title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
10:44 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <vmassol> sdumitriu: some cache issue with the broken link on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download ?  
10:47 <@sdumitriu> Let me check  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> Could be  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> The one to Source Repository, right?  
10:48 <vmassol> es  
10:48 <vmassol> \*yes  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> Lots of missing docs: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> I'll flush cache  
10:48 <vmassol> ok  
10:49 <@sdumitriu> BTW, noticed a bug: cross-wiki create links set as parent a document without the wiki prefix  
10:49 <@sdumitriu> So the parent for the SourceRepo document was dev:Main.Download instead of xwiki:Main.Download  
10:50 <vmassol> hmm indeed that's an important bug  
10:50 <@sdumitriu> Can you report it?  
10:50 <vmassol> maybe that could explain the watchlist bug I've been seeing  
10:50 <vmassol> happens only sometimes  
10:50 <vmassol> when you click on a link you are directed to the wrong wiki  
10:50 <@sdumitriu> Missing docs are now fixed  
10:50 <vmassol> btw someone is asking to join the infra list  
10:51 <vmassol> I don't recall our strategy  
10:51 <vmassol> looking for mail...  
10:52 <vmassol> "All committers are free to request to be added to it. Non committers who wish to  
10:52 <vmassol> help with the platform can also ask."  
10:52 <vmassol> ok I'll ask the guy to send a mail on devs to explain why he wants to join the list  
10:52 <vmassol> and how he'd like to help  
10:55 <@sdumitriu> Hm, did someone change ludovic's password on wikimatrix?  
10:55 <@sdumitriu> I can't login anymore  
10:56 <vmassol> yes he changed it himself  
10:56 <vmassol> sending it to you on skype  
10:57 <vmassol> we need thomas to define our location where to put "community" passwords  
10:58 <vmassol> (see mail on Build actions, there's an item for that)  
11:03 <@sdumitriu> Sad: 0 followers for xwikiorg  
11:03 <vmassol> why would you expect followers when 1) it's new, 2) not been announced anywhere  
11:03 <vmassol> :)  
11:03 <vmassol> I was waiting for something to be tweeted  
11:03 <vmassol> before announcing it  
11:03 <@sdumitriu> Well, at least we should follow it  
11:04 <vmassol> we haven't announced it yet  
11:04 <vmassol> and the devs don't need to follow it  
11:04 <vmassol> we already know everything that'll be posted on it  
11:05 <@sdumitriu> Yeah, but that's not how social networks work  
11:05 <@sdumitriu> We need to follow it not because it says new, useful stuff  
11:05 <vmassol> just tweet something and I'll announce it  
11:05 <@sdumitriu> But because this is how it can be popular  
11:05 <@sdumitriu> Yes, composing it now  
11:10 <vmassol> announement done  
11:10 <vmassol> hmm http://t.co/n7v2fNU isn't working for me  
11:10 <vmassol> (sdumitriu)  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> Works for me  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> No idea why twitter is so stupid  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> I already provided a short URL  
11:11 <vmassol> it's not twitter  
11:11 <vmassol> it's your client that you've configured to shorten it I guess  
11:11 <vmassol> I have this disabled by default on my client  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> My client = twitter web  
11:11 <vmassol> so that I decide if I want to shorten it  
11:12 <vmassol> hmm  
11:12 <@sdumitriu> I don't use that much twitter to need a client for it  
11:12 <vmassol> so it's working for you?  
11:12 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
11:12 <vmassol> ok works now  
11:12 <vmassol> strange it was failing for the past 3 mn  
11:12 <@sdumitriu> Already checked it myself before you said it  
11:12 <vmassol> hmmm  
11:12 <vmassol> you decide not to follow the release process  
11:12 <vmassol> shoudl we change it?  
11:12 <vmassol> re the tweet  
11:13 <vmassol> it's mentionned to point to the blog post  
11:13 <vmassol> but you pointed to the release notes  
11:13 <@sdumitriu> Hm...  
11:13 <vmassol> which means btw that there's no download link  
11:13 <vmassol> I wanted to advertise the blog post  
11:14 <vmassol> you think it's not a good idea?  
11:15 <@sdumitriu> Yes, it is  
11:15 <@sdumitriu> It should point to the blog now  
11:15 <@sdumitriu> (I modified the purl)  
11:15 <vmassol> nice that you can do that  
11:15 <vmassol> didn't know about it  
11:15 <vmassol> :)  
11:15 <@sdumitriu> And for me it does redirect to the BP  
11:15 <vmassol> works here too  
11:16 <vmassol> thanks  
11:16 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <@sdumitriu> Going to sleep  
11:16 <@sdumitriu> Hm, where did 4 AM go?  
11:16 <@sdumitriu> Went right by me  
11:16 <vmassol> nn  
11:17 <vmassol> :)  
11:17 <vmassol> thanks for the release  
11:37 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <rrodriguez> has quit  
11:48 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
12:31 <polx> has quit  
12:53 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
13:04 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:16 <mflorea> has quit  
13:23 <goro> has joined #xwiki  
13:39 <vmassol> would be great if we could fix http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/70/testReport/  
13:39 <vmassol> and then we would have an all blue status: http://ci.xwiki.org/  
13:39 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/portlet/dashboard\_portlet\_9/  
13:44 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <polx> has quit  
13:51 <vmassol> cjdelisle: putting us both as build manager for this week  
13:52 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I'd like to continue the work on fixing the failing attachment tests. Maybe we could sync  
13:52 <pulasthi1> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <pulasthi> has quit  
14:00 <vmassol> abusenius: good morning  
14:00 <vmassol> I see someone added the following in AbstractTest:         getUtil().recacheSecretToken();  
14:00 <vmassol> this causes the registration page to be loaded for each test  
14:04 <+abusenius> vmassol: hi  
14:04 <+abusenius> looking  
14:07 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <+abusenius> vmassol: afaik setContext is only called at the beginning of a test run, when the server is started etc  
14:10 <vmassol> indeed it's called once  
14:10 <vmassol> I was running a single test  
14:10 <vmassol> it still is hard to understand why you'd have to go to the registration page  
14:11 <vmassol> that looks a bit circumvoluted just to get the token id  
14:11 <+abusenius> well, it always contains a secret token  
14:11 <+abusenius> yes  
14:11 <vmassol> shouldn't we have a URL action to return the token instead?  
14:12 <+abusenius> no, that would make it too easy to circumvent  
14:12 <vmassol> but going to the registration page is the same  
14:13 <+abusenius> well, there we still need to parse the text, we cannot do anything about this, the token is included there anyway  
14:13 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <+abusenius> and normally, extracting the secret token is not needed  
14:13 <vmassol> so why do we do it?  
14:14 <+abusenius> because some of the tests are exploiting xwiki using csrf for efficiency and simplicity  
14:14 <vmassol> we could also turn CSRF protection for the tests but it won't test it then….  
14:15 <vmassol> s/turn/turn off/  
14:15 <+abusenius> I think the current solution is acceptable for testing purposes and does what it should  
14:16 <vmassol> actually I could also create a new page with preview action and have $service.csrf.token() in it  
14:17 <vmassol> (not sure if it works, might need to save the page)  
14:17 <+abusenius> this methond is not always called with edit rights  
14:18 <vmassol> indeed  
14:18 <+abusenius> so we would need to create and save a page with the token so that it is visible for everyone  
14:19 <vmassol> abusenius: why do we need to get the token only once in the test suite?  
14:19 <vmassol> isn't it needed for each user that logs in?  
14:20 <vmassol> and if the user isn't logged in the returned token will be useless right?  
14:20 <+abusenius> it is, this is the first initialization  
14:20 <+abusenius> it is recached when you relogin  
14:20 <vmassol> so why not get the token only in the login method?  
14:21 <+abusenius> and if noone is logged in, then the guest is logged in, who also has a token, which is not really useful  
14:21 <+abusenius> not all tests run as admin  
14:21 <vmassol> so there's a need for the csrf token even when not logged in?  
14:21 <polx> has quit  
14:22 <+abusenius> well, to submit the login form  
14:22 <vmassol> I see  
14:23 <pturcotte> has quit  
14:23 <+abusenius> it is not very useful, because everyone shares the token in that case, but still prevents some attacks to not public wikis  
14:23 <+abusenius> s/not public/private/  
14:24 <vmassol> abusenius: why don't you recache in     public String getURLToLoginAndGotoPage(final String username, final String password, final String pageURL)  
14:24 <vmassol>  ?  
14:25 <+abusenius> because it only returns the url to login  
14:25 <+abusenius> does not actually logs user in  
14:25 <+abusenius> the caller needs to decide which token he wants, before or after login  
14:25 <vmassol> there's AndGotoPage  
14:26 <+abusenius> isn't it this xredirect thing?  
14:26 <vmassol> I see you've added this in a page:  
14:26 <vmassol>             getDriver().get(getUtil().getURLToLoginAsAdminAndGotoPage(grasp.getURL()));  
14:26 <vmassol>             getUtil().recacheSecretToken();  
14:26 <vmassol> s/page/test/  
14:27 <vmassol> yes you're right, got it  
14:27 <vmassol> getDriver().get() is the action  
14:27 <vmassol> the api is wrongly named...  
14:27 <vmassol> misleading at least  
14:28 <+abusenius> yea, it is meant to be "get URL to (login, then got to given page)"  
14:29 <vmassol> hmmm we could also compute the token  
14:30 <vmassol> (using DefaultCSRFToken for ex)  
14:30 <+abusenius> this method (and some other similar) are meant to do nasty optimizations with several xredirects  
14:30 <vmassol> that would be nice since we wouldn't need to do any navigation  
14:30 <vmassol> ah the random would be missing I guess  
14:30 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:30 <vmassol> private SecureRandom random;  
14:30 <vmassol> (just looked at the code… ;))  
14:31 <+abusenius> we would need to access the instance used in the server :)  
14:35 <vmassol> abusenius: ok thanks. I understand now (not that I like it too much but at least I get it)  
14:37 <vmassol> abusenius: one solution to make this more invisible would be to use Commons HttpClient to call the registration page and extract the info….  
14:38 <+abusenius> yea, we could do that, but whats the point?  
14:38 <vmassol> prevent devs from spending time wondering what's going on  
14:38 <vmassol> :)  
14:38 <vmassol> exactly what I just did  
14:39 <vmassol> I saw the registration page when executing my test and I thought: WTF....  
14:39 <vmassol> then I debugged, put some breakpints  
14:39 <vmassol> and found the csrf stuff  
14:39 <vmassol> which I then needed to understand  
14:39 <vmassol> and I asked you here  
14:39 <vmassol> :)  
14:39 <vmassol> but yes....  
14:39 <+abusenius> ok, I see :)  
14:40 <vmassol> at least it prompted you to close the jira issue ;)  
14:42 <+abusenius> :)  
14:42 <mmaksimov> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <polx> has quit  
14:46 <mmaksimov> Hi. I've imported into xwiki 3.1 a page with "/" in its name. It was created under 3.0 and everything worked fine. However, the 3.1 server shows links to the page but does not open it. It also does not delete, copy, rename, etc. Is it possible to change page name in DB to remove that "/" symbol?  
14:49 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
14:57 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:04 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
15:09 <goro> has quit  
15:15 <mmaksimov> has quit  
15:16 <xgoro> has joined #xwiki  
15:17 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I've removed one flickering in AttachmentTest  
15:21 <vmassol> cjdelisle: fyi I'm testing with FF network.prefetch to false  
15:23 <polx> has quit  
15:24 <vmassol> ok it's not that since I still got one failure out of 100  
15:26 <@cjdelisle> I'm going to be gone later on today but I will continue working on the attachment deletion issue until then.  
15:26 <vmassol> ok anything that I could test to help out?  
15:27 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:28 <@cjdelisle> I'm just trying to isolate which call is causing it so I'm building with some calls removed from the deleteXWikiAttachment function.  
15:39 <+sburjan> any idea if I have Java 7, could I run xwiki ?  
15:40 <+sburjan> or I need jse/jdk 6 ?  
15:40 <+sburjan> I don't want to build, only to run  
15:40 <vmassol> so far the java version have  been backward compat  
15:40 <vmassol> you could try  
15:40 <+sburjan> because itseems I can't find on the oracle site the download for jdk 6 :|  
15:40 <vmassol> if you want to be on the safe side, use 6  
15:40 <+sburjan> okay, trying  
15:40 <vmassol> if you want to have fun try 7  
15:41 <+sburjan> I don't want more fun, I need something as much as compatible :)  
15:41 <+sburjan> creating a custom infra build  
15:41 <vmassol> then don't use 7  
15:41 <+sburjan> on a windows server machine  
15:41 <+sburjan> ok  
15:41 <vmassol> use 6  
15:41 <vmassol> we don't support 7 officially  
15:41 <vmassol> windows..hmm.. so you do want to have some fun it seems ;)  
15:41 <+sburjan> I wamma go on the safe road, becasue there are a ton of stuff than can fail, and I need a solid configuration  
15:42 <+sburjan> yes, with Active Directory, Kerberos and https :)  
15:42 <vmassol> and you're calling this solid? :)  
15:42 <+sburjan> well.. there are a ton of stuff that can fail, I don't want to risk using a newer jdk and introduce a new possible set of issues :)  
16:00 <vmassol> cjdelisle: dunno if it helps but I've modified the testUploadDownloadTwoAttachments test to only upload a single doc and I still got a failure so at least we know it's not because of the 2 attachments....  
16:02 <@cjdelisle> If you just view the attachment a million times, it works fine. If you add the same code to a unit test then it works fine.  
16:02 <@cjdelisle> What I think is happening is the browser gets it's header back before the attachment is completely saved and it's a race condition.  
16:03 <vmassol> hmmm is that possible ? that would mean hibernate returns before saving no?  
16:03 <vmassol> (since we're only doing this in a single thread)  
16:07 <polx> has quit  
16:07 <@cjdelisle> that's possible. There is a database thread, an xwiki thread and the browser/test.  
16:09 <+mflorea> vmassol: I have a maven question for you. If you define multiple repos in settings.xml, each with its own id (which is required right?) then I have to duplicate the server configuration if all these repos are on the same server which requires access. Is there a way to avoid this duplication?  
16:10 <+mflorea> the documentation says that server id must match the repo id  
16:10 <vmassol> server and repo are different things  
16:10 <+mflorea> so I have to copy the server (access) configuration N times  
16:10 <+mflorea> I know  
16:10 <vmassol> server is used when deploying  
16:11 <vmassol> repo is used for downloading  
16:11 <+mflorea> what if the repo private?  
16:11 <+mflorea> you still need to define the access config  
16:11 <+mflorea> even for download  
16:11 <vmassol> sure if you want an addition remote repo you need to add it  
16:11 <vmassol> not sure I understand the question  
16:12 <vmassol> cjdelisle: database thread? never heard of this one. Is it something internal to hibernate?  
16:13 <+mflorea> I have 3 private access repos defined in the setting.xml . For each of them I have to write a "server" element with the access config. if all these repos are on the same sever then the access config is duplicated 3 times  
16:13 <@cjdelisle> I assume hsqldb is running in it's own thread.  
16:13 <vmassol> mflorea: yes  
16:13 <vmassol> the fact that they are on the same machine or not doesn't matter  
16:14 <+mflorea> ok, so I assume I can't avoid the duplication  
16:14 <@cjdelisle> mflorea: I'm having trouble building platform-gwt tests, I get this: http://pastebin.com/9bK5ccn3 do you have any idea wheere I should look for trouble?  
16:14 <vmassol> cjdelisle: that would be strange  
16:14 <vmassol> are you sure?  
16:14 <vmassol> (we're running in embedded mode)  
16:15 <@cjdelisle> I'm not sure but how else would it react when you sent it a request?  
16:15 <+mflorea> cjdelisle: I have never seen such an exception  
16:16 <+mflorea> by platform-gwt do you mean the entire xwiki-platform-gwt module (wihch submodules)?  
16:16 <@cjdelisle> Do you know what it might be looking for? connecting to localhost? where I might find the place that it tells gwt to connect?  
16:17 <vmassol> cjdelisle: you just call a method  
16:17 <vmassol> in the same memory space  
16:17 <vmassol> we're running it in embedded mode  
16:17 <vmassol> same jvm  
16:18 <pturcotte> has quit  
16:18 <@cjdelisle> Ok. I thought it still interfaced through a socket.  
16:18 <vmassol> see http://hsqldb.org/doc/guide/ch01.html  
16:18 <vmassol> http://hsqldb.org/doc/guide/ch01.html#N1013D  
16:18 <vmassol> we're using "In-Process (Standalone) Mode"  
16:19 <vmassol> now they do say "In 1.8.0, you can run a server instance in a thread from the same virtual machine as your application and provide external access to your in-process database."  
16:19 <vmassol> I didn't know about this but I doubt it's on by default  
16:22 <@cjdelisle> ok so if that's not enabled then we can isolate it to:  firefox/test and xwiki/db  
16:22 <vmassol> cjdelisle: found this though:  
16:22 <vmassol> "HSQLDB Timer @395c7b94" daemon prio=5 tid=7febae4ea800 nid=0x11331c000 in Object.wait() [11331b000]  
16:22 <vmassol>    java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED\_WAITING (on object monitor)  
16:22 <vmassol>         at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)  
16:22 <vmassol>         - waiting on <7dbe3af08> (a org.hsqldb.lib.HsqlTimer)  
16:22 <vmassol>         at org.hsqldb.lib.HsqlTimer.nextTask(Unknown Source)  
16:22 <vmassol>         - locked <7dbe3af08> (a org.hsqldb.lib.HsqlTimer)  
16:22 <vmassol>         at org.hsqldb.lib.HsqlTimer$TaskRunner.run(Unknown Source)  
16:22 <vmassol>         at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)  
16:22 <vmassol> I sent a QUIT signal to XE  
16:23 <vmassol> stats and lucene need to be disabled too  
16:23 <vmassol> to make sure they're not causing race  
16:24 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <vmassol> http://www.docjar.com/docs/api/org/hsqldb/lib/HsqlTimer.html  
16:27 <JuanDaugherty> how do you flush cache's? Particularly the thumbnails of ActivityStream  
16:27 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
16:28 <+mflorea> vmassol: I removed com/xpn/\* and org/xwiki/\* folders from ~/.m2/repository/ and now maven complains it can't find xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb 3.2-SNAPSHOT. The problem is that it tries to download http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/3.2-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.2-SNAPSHOT.zip but http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/e  
16:28 <+mflorea> btw, I try to run the ui tests  
16:29 <vmassol> mflorea: have you updated your settings.xml with the latest config from the building page?  
16:30 <vmassol> it's there: http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/3.2-SNAPSHOT/  
16:30 <vmassol> run with -U maybe mflorea  
16:33 <vmassol> cjdelisle: if it was a race condition, wouldn't putitng a Thread.sleep just after ap.clickAttachFiles(); make the probem disappear?  
16:34 <@cjdelisle> Indeed it would.  
16:35 <vmassol> trying it again but I think I tested that before and I still got the error  
16:40 <@cjdelisle> Another thing to check is whether the attachment download works on the second (or Nth) try.  
16:41 <vmassol> I tried that already  
16:41 <vmassol> and it doesn't  
16:41 <vmassol> I put a breakpoint when it fails  
16:41 <vmassol> then I navigated in the browser  
16:42 <vmassol> even refreshed the cache with flushCache  
16:42 <vmassol> and the attachment was still showing empty  
16:42 <@cjdelisle> hmm ok so it's a flat out failure to upload.  
16:42 <vmassol> not sure  
16:43 <vmassol> because when I put a breakpoint on the server side  
16:43 <vmassol> and I look at variable values they seem ok after the problem has been found  
16:43 <vmassol> ah wait  
16:43 <vmassol> the reason for the browser still showing an empty attachment  
16:43 <vmassol> is because of browser client cache  
16:43 <vmassol> (I remember now)  
16:44 <vmassol> so if you clear it the attachment starts working again  
16:44 <vmassol> (because DownloadAction will call the server again)  
16:44 <vmassol> so it does work if you retry a second time  
16:45 <+mflorea> vmassol: My settings.xml is updated and I use -U, the error is:  
16:45 <+mflorea> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-dependency-plugin:2.1:unpack (unzip-application) on project xwiki-enterprise-test-ui: Unable to find artifact. 22:32 <qwebirc50962> hello All. quick question, i know its easy to change the logo and Skin, but is there anything built in to change that whole header?  
22:33 <@sdumitriu> Yes, just modify and attach a different global.vm to your skin  
22:36 <rrodriguez\_> has joined #xwiki  
22:36 <qwebirc50962> Great! thank you for the quick response. checking into it right now! :)  
22:36 <rrodriguez> has quit  
22:36 <rrodriguez\_> is now known as <rrodriguez>  
22:37 <@sdumitriu> qwebirc50962: Read http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Skins#HHowtooverrideaSkin  
22:46 <qwebirc50962> wait is that overriding a skin an alternative to changing the global.vm  
22:47 <@sdumitriu> Because when you want to upgrade, you'll have to take care not to lose the global.vm that you modified  
22:48 <@sdumitriu> But if it's in a custom skin, you don't have this problem; the database documents stay in place during upgrades  
22:49 <qwebirc50962> okay I see what your saying
